since_last_update: US labor cooling signal: initial jobless claims rose to 231k vs 212k expected (LOCAL); pushes the tape toward lower front-end yields but introduces a “growth scare vs rate relief” split for ES/NQ.
Tech/AI capex shock as a micro-to-macro driver: Alphabet sold off after flagging materially higher 2026 AI capex, reinforcing duration/mega-cap concentration sensitivity in NQ (AP, Investors.com).

Metals volatility remains a live cross-asset stressor: silver saw another sharp leg down (intraday ~double-digit %), with gold also pressured; commentary points to liquidation/thin liquidity dynamics rather than new fundamentals (MarketWatch, Reuters via Express Tribune).

Geopolitics tilts toward de-escalation risk premium compression: U.S.–Iran talks confirmed for Friday in Oman, contributing to softer oil/risk-premium impulses vs earlier escalation fears (Barron's, Reuters via Express Tribune).

UK rates repricing adds a global duration impulse: BoE held at 3.75% but the close vote/guidance narrative leaned markets toward more cuts this year; second-order support to global rates-sensitive assets, but not a primary US driver (Guardian, LOCAL).
today_focus: Dominant driver check: cross-asset “de-risking” is being reinforced by (1) tech/AI capex skepticism in mega-cap earnings reactions and (2) ongoing precious-metals liquidation/volatility—both can tighten financial conditions via VAR/margin channels (AP, MarketWatch).

Rates vs growth balance: claims surprise is dovish for front-end pricing, but watch whether equities read it as benign disinflationary cooling (NQ-positive) or demand deterioration (ES/RTY-negative) (LOCAL, Investors.com).

Gold focus: gold is not trading as a clean haven; USD strength + volatility/forced selling dynamics appear to be the nearer-term driver, so correlations can invert quickly intraday (Reuters via Express Tribune, MarketWatch).
Oil/geopolitics: market appears to be pricing reduced near-term Middle East tail risk into the Friday Oman talks, keeping oil/risk premia headline-sensitive (Barron's, Reuters via Express Tribune).

Next print risk: JOLTS (10:00 ET) is the key near-term confirmer/denier of the labor-cooling narrative; surprise weakness would reinforce the dovish/rates-down impulse but raise recession-tail chatter (Investing.com calendar).

market_pricing.dominant_narrative: Risk sentiment is being driven more by (a) earnings-linked tech-duration repricing (AI capex/semis) and (b) volatility/liquidation in precious metals than by a single clean macro data impulse; labor data is currently a secondary but important confirmation lever.

rates.what_market_seems_to_price: Incremental shift toward easier policy path near-term on softer labor signals (claims), with sensitivity high to any additional labor cooling confirmation from JOLTS/sentiment inflation expectations.
rates.what_is_likely_underpriced: Two-way risk: (1) ‘growth scare’ escalation if labor softening broadens beyond claims; (2) sticky inflation/real-yield snapback if today’s data or Fed speak pushes back against easing expectations.

equities.what_market_seems_to_price: Higher dispersion and increased penalty for high-duration/AI-exposed names when capex expectations rise; index performance increasingly dictated by mega-cap/AI complex and positioning.
equities.what_is_likely_underpriced: Index-level vulnerability to mechanical deleveraging if metals volatility triggers broader VAR shocks; concentration risk makes ES more correlated to NQ in stress.

gold.what_market_seems_to_price: Near-term gold behavior dominated by USD/real-rate sensitivity plus volatility/positioning (forced selling), not purely geopolitics.
gold.what_is_likely_underpriced: Further correlation breaks: gold can fall alongside equities if liquidation persists; conversely, sharp squeezes are possible if USD weakens or rates drop meaningfully.

fx_usd.what_market_seems_to_price: USD supported by risk-off tone and policy-credibility expectations; stronger USD is a headwind for gold and some risk assets (Reuters via Express Tribune).
fx_usd.what_is_likely_underpriced: If US data weakens materially, USD support could fade quickly, flipping gold’s direction even if risk assets remain heavy.

risk_register.risk: Metals-volatility-to-cross-asset contagion (margin/VAR liquidation causing equity/credit air pockets; gold not acting as hedge).
Tech-duration de-rating broadens on AI capex shock and semiconductor/AI supply-chain warnings; NQ-driven index drag via concentration.
Labor-data pivot risk: JOLTS + sentiment can either validate benign cooling (rates down, NQ relief) or trigger growth scare (ES/RTY pressure).
Geopolitical headline gap into/around Friday U.S.–Iran talks; rapid repricing in oil/gold/USTs and equity vol.
USD strength persistence tightens global conditions, weighs commodities and non-US risk, and keeps gold under pressure during liquidation phases.

event_warnings: Feb 5, 2026 10:00 ET: JOLTS Job Openings — key labor-demand confirmation; large downside surprise can shift Fed-path pricing and risk tone quickly (Investing.com calendar).
Feb 5, 2026: Earnings/AI complex sensitivity — mega-cap/semis guidance can dominate NQ and spill into ES via concentration (AP, Investors.com).
Feb 6, 2026 (time unclear/in headline window): U.S.–Iran talks in Oman — binary headline risk for oil, gold, and risk premia (Barron's, Reuters via Express Tribune).

Feb 6, 2026 10:00 ET: Univ. of Michigan sentiment + inflation expectations — can move real yields and therefore NQ and gold in opposite directions depending on the inflation-expectations component (ForexFactory calendar provided).
Ongoing: Precious-metals microstructure stress — watch for outsized intraday moves that can force cross-asset deleveraging (MarketWatch).
